values.description:
The large diff is the result of rearranging the components, `ogre` and `optix`, from ign-rendering/src to the root directory. 

The code is mainly the same except updates to 

* header guard

* visibility macro, e.g.  now using `IGNITION_RENDERING_XXX_VISIBLE`

* CMakeLists.txt

This PR uses the following ign branches:

* ign-cmake: `Components`

* ign-common: ~~Components~~ `ign-common1`

* ign-math: `ign-math4`

Note: ign-cmake's `Components` branch is upgraded to ign-cmake1 which conflicts with any existing deb installation of ign-cmake0 (as [described here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/51/guard-against-accidentally-switching-to/diff)). However, ign-math4 still depends on ign-cmake0. So you'll need to install ign-cmake0 from source using the `ign-cmake0` branch in ign-cmake
values.title: Ign-cmake integration

summary.raw:
The large diff is the result of rearranging the components, `ogre` and `optix`, from ign-rendering/src to the root directory. 

The code is mainly the same except updates to 

* header guard

* visibility macro, e.g.  now using `IGNITION_RENDERING_XXX_VISIBLE`

* CMakeLists.txt

This PR uses the following ign branches:

* ign-cmake: `Components`

* ign-common: ~~Components~~ `ign-common1`

* ign-math: `ign-math4`

Note: ign-cmake's `Components` branch is upgraded to ign-cmake1 which conflicts with any existing deb installation of ign-cmake0 (as [described here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/51/guard-against-accidentally-switching-to/diff)). However, ign-math4 still depends on ign-cmake0. So you'll need to install ign-cmake0 from source using the `ign-cmake0` branch in ign-cmake
summary.html:
The large diff is the result of rearranging the components, ogre and optix, from ign-rendering/src to the root directory.

The code is mainly the same except updates to

  • header guard

  • visibility macro, e.g. now using IGNITION_RENDERING_XXX_VISIBLE

  • CMakeLists.txt

This PR uses the following ign branches:

  • ign-cmake: Components

  • ign-common: Components ign-common1

  • ign-math: ign-math4

Note: ign-cmake's Components branch is upgraded to ign-cmake1 which conflicts with any existing deb installation of ign-cmake0 (as described here). However, ign-math4 still depends on ign-cmake0. So you'll need to install ign-cmake0 from source using the ign-cmake0 branch in ign-cmake

values.description:
Based on: https://github.com/ros-visualization/rviz/pull/1141

Rather than distribute arial, which is licensed by Microsoft, this pull request replaces it with the open licensed Liberation Sans (sponsored by Redhat), which also gives us permission to distribute the font to ensure a working font is always available.

See:

https://www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/Liberation-Sans
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liberation_fonts
values.title: Replace Arial

values.description:
Added `Begin` and `End` functions so we can iterate through a `BaseStorage` class \(which encapsulates `std::map`\)

The changes are the result of performance profiling using [Flame Graphs](https://github.com/brendangregg/FlameGraph) on a scene filled with an army of 2500 ducks

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/2016609119-duck_army.png)
You can see the perf results [Before](https://www.dropbox.com/s/sb423to83e1pter/rend-before.svg?dl=0) and [After](https://www.dropbox.com/s/4c9a4d9bcpkvf9h/rend-after.svg?dl=0) the changes. The svg files are interactive and best viewed in a browser. Pay attention to the Before image \(left-half\) where ign-rendering spends a large chunk of time in the `PreRenderChildren` function due to inefficient looping of `std::map.`Looping with iterators helps significant reduce the amount of time spent in that function.
values.title: Support iterating through storage objects using iterators for performance improvement

summary.raw:
Added `Begin` and `End` functions so we can iterate through a `BaseStorage` class \(which encapsulates `std::map`\)

The changes are the result of performance profiling using [Flame Graphs](https://github.com/brendangregg/FlameGraph) on a scene filled with an army of 2500 ducks

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/2016609119-duck_army.png)
You can see the perf results [Before](https://www.dropbox.com/s/sb423to83e1pter/rend-before.svg?dl=0) and [After](https://www.dropbox.com/s/4c9a4d9bcpkvf9h/rend-after.svg?dl=0) the changes. The svg files are interactive and best viewed in a browser. Pay attention to the Before image \(left-half\) where ign-rendering spends a large chunk of time in the `PreRenderChildren` function due to inefficient looping of `std::map.`Looping with iterators helps significant reduce the amount of time spent in that function.
summary.html:
Added Begin and End functions so we can iterate through a BaseStorage class (which encapsulates std::map)

The changes are the result of performance profiling using Flame Graphs on a scene filled with an army of 2500 ducks

You can see the perf results Before and After the changes. The svg files are interactive and best viewed in a browser. Pay attention to the Before image (left-half) where ign-rendering spends a large chunk of time in the PreRenderChildren function due to inefficient looping of std::map.Looping with iterators helps significant reduce the amount of time spent in that function.

values.description:
The motivation is that [Display Plugins](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31) can attach all of their custom visuals to a single visual, for which the visibility is then toggled on and off. You can imagine the TF display in RViz as an extreme case: without something like this, that plugin has to keep track of all of its custom visuals and iterate through them when the display is enabled/disabled. With this PR, toggling of visibility is handled in the [base class](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/src/e055a5a0b3a228b023775a729a28120b67d24608/src/DisplayPlugin.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#DisplayPlugin.cc-188), and subclasses don’t have to worry about it.

I implemented this copying `SetInheritScale`. I didn't add `Visible()` getter like there is an `InheritScale()` because AFAIK Ogre [doesn’t support it](https://forums.ogre3d.org/viewtopic.php?t=67348).

What is potentially an issue with this PR is that I didn’t find a similar notion for toggling visibility for Optix Groups. I am not sure how we want to proceed when it’s not just that it isn’t *currently *implemented for Optix, it might be that, for fundamental reasons, it won’t *ever* be implemented?

‌
values.title: Add SetVisible for Visual

summary.raw:
The motivation is that [Display Plugins](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31) can attach all of their custom visuals to a single visual, for which the visibility is then toggled on and off. You can imagine the TF display in RViz as an extreme case: without something like this, that plugin has to keep track of all of its custom visuals and iterate through them when the display is enabled/disabled. With this PR, toggling of visibility is handled in the [base class](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/src/e055a5a0b3a228b023775a729a28120b67d24608/src/DisplayPlugin.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#DisplayPlugin.cc-188), and subclasses don’t have to worry about it.

I implemented this copying `SetInheritScale`. I didn't add `Visible()` getter like there is an `InheritScale()` because AFAIK Ogre [doesn’t support it](https://forums.ogre3d.org/viewtopic.php?t=67348).

What is potentially an issue with this PR is that I didn’t find a similar notion for toggling visibility for Optix Groups. I am not sure how we want to proceed when it’s not just that it isn’t *currently *implemented for Optix, it might be that, for fundamental reasons, it won’t *ever* be implemented?

‌
summary.html:
The motivation is that Display Plugins can attach all of their custom visuals to a single visual, for which the visibility is then toggled on and off. You can imagine the TF display in RViz as an extreme case: without something like this, that plugin has to keep track of all of its custom visuals and iterate through them when the display is enabled/disabled. With this PR, toggling of visibility is handled in the base class, and subclasses don’t have to worry about it.

I implemented this copying SetInheritScale. I didn't add Visible() getter like there is an InheritScale() because AFAIK Ogre doesn’t support it.

What is potentially an issue with this PR is that I didn’t find a similar notion for toggling visibility for Optix Groups. I am not sure how we want to proceed when it’s not just that it isn’t currently implemented for Optix, it might be that, for fundamental reasons, it won’t ever be implemented?

‌

values.description:
This is the first part of the ogre2 integration. A working version is in the `ogre2` branch and I’m just splitting it out to smaller PRs.

In this PR, I integrated the core ogre2 render engine. The setup code is actually quite similar to ogre 1.x but with some minor differences:

* ogre 2 loads GL3\+ render system plugin
* ogre2 registers and loads materials resources referred to as Hlms \(High level material system\). The resources files are taken from ogre2 samples framework and stored in the `ogre2/src/media` directory.
* there are also a few minor API changes between ogre 1.x vs ogre 2.x

Currently this branch should just build and doesn’t do anything more.
values.title: Ogre 2.1: Basic engine integration

summary.raw:
This is the first part of the ogre2 integration. A working version is in the `ogre2` branch and I’m just splitting it out to smaller PRs.

In this PR, I integrated the core ogre2 render engine. The setup code is actually quite similar to ogre 1.x but with some minor differences:

* ogre 2 loads GL3\+ render system plugin
* ogre2 registers and loads materials resources referred to as Hlms \(High level material system\). The resources files are taken from ogre2 samples framework and stored in the `ogre2/src/media` directory.
* there are also a few minor API changes between ogre 1.x vs ogre 2.x

Currently this branch should just build and doesn’t do anything more.
summary.html:
This is the first part of the ogre2 integration. A working version is in the ogre2 branch and I’m just splitting it out to smaller PRs.

In this PR, I integrated the core ogre2 render engine. The setup code is actually quite similar to ogre 1.x but with some minor differences:

  • ogre 2 loads GL3+ render system plugin
  • ogre2 registers and loads materials resources referred to as Hlms (High level material system). The resources files are taken from ogre2 samples framework and stored in the ogre2/src/media directory.
  • there are also a few minor API changes between ogre 1.x vs ogre 2.x

Currently this branch should just build and doesn’t do anything more.

values.description:
[issue #25](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/issues/25/ogretext-not-rendering-after-66)

there is a problem in Visual::PreRenderGeometry when looping through geometries after the changes in [pull request #66](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/66/support-iterating-through-storage-objects/diff)

This PR reverts the relevant changes. The performance improvement from pull request #66 still stands as the bottleneck was mainly in the `Visuall::PreRenderChildren` function but I decided to keep the code consistent which led to this issue.
values.title: Revert a change in Visual to fix Text geometry

summary.raw:
[issue #25](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/issues/25/ogretext-not-rendering-after-66)

there is a problem in Visual::PreRenderGeometry when looping through geometries after the changes in [pull request #66](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/66/support-iterating-through-storage-objects/diff)

This PR reverts the relevant changes. The performance improvement from pull request #66 still stands as the bottleneck was mainly in the `Visuall::PreRenderChildren` function but I decided to keep the code consistent which led to this issue.
summary.html:
issue #25

there is a problem in Visual::PreRenderGeometry when looping through geometries after the changes in pull request #66

This PR reverts the relevant changes. The performance improvement from pull request #66 still stands as the bottleneck was mainly in the Visuall::PreRenderChildren function but I decided to keep the code consistent which led to this issue.

values.description: My bad for merging pull request #69 without checking pipelines. There was a [false positive style issue](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/491) caused by commenting out the function arg. Instead of suppressing it, I just printed the variable out.
values.title: Style fix

summary.raw: My bad for merging pull request #69 without checking pipelines. There was a [false positive style issue](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/491) caused by commenting out the function arg. Instead of suppressing it, I just printed the variable out.
summary.html: My bad for merging pull request #69 without checking pipelines. There was a false positive style issue caused by commenting out the function arg. Instead of suppressing it, I just printed the variable out.

values.description:
This PR removes the visibility from templated classes \(since they are header only and computed at compiling time we don’t need to define binary visibility on them\). Includes a couple of ignores about igh common uses.

It also fixes the clang compiler warnings about overrides.
values.title: Several MSVC/Clang fixes: templates visibility and overrides

summary.raw:
This PR removes the visibility from templated classes \(since they are header only and computed at compiling time we don’t need to define binary visibility on them\). Includes a couple of ignores about igh common uses.

It also fixes the clang compiler warnings about overrides.
summary.html:
This PR removes the visibility from templated classes (since they are header only and computed at compiling time we don’t need to define binary visibility on them). Includes a couple of ignores about igh common uses.

It also fixes the clang compiler warnings about overrides.

values.description:
The previous behavior loads all the render engine plugins as soon as ign-rendering is launched. The changes make sure that the render engine is only loaded if they are requested \(e.g. through `engine("engine_name")`\)

This more efficient and also necessary as ogre1 and ogre2 can not be loaded at the same time.
values.title: Load render engines on demand

summary.raw:
The previous behavior loads all the render engine plugins as soon as ign-rendering is launched. The changes make sure that the render engine is only loaded if they are requested \(e.g. through `engine("engine_name")`\)

This more efficient and also necessary as ogre1 and ogre2 can not be loaded at the same time.
summary.html:
The previous behavior loads all the render engine plugins as soon as ign-rendering is launched. The changes make sure that the render engine is only loaded if they are requested (e.g. through engine("engine_name"))

This more efficient and also necessary as ogre1 and ogre2 can not be loaded at the same time.

values.description:
There are a few codecheck errors on artful and bionic:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-default-artful-amd64/13/cppcheckResult/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-default-bionic-amd64/7/cppcheckResult/

This fixes both artful errors and some of the other bionic errors. I also improved the code coverage of ShaderParam since I added an assignment operator in order to follow the rule of 3.
values.title: Fix artful and some bionic codecheck errors

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-default-bionic-amd64/7/cppcheckResult/

This fixes both artful errors and some of the other bionic errors. I also improved the code coverage of ShaderParam since I added an assignment operator in order to follow the rule of 3.

values.description:
Last round of Windows fixes \(although we still we have a linking issue to resolve\):

* Enable the use of IgnFindOGRE
* MSVC complained about the ambiguos use of type Node in templates \(coming from multiple heritance\)
* Change API: [CreateWindow seems to be part of a Windows API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms632679(v=vs.85).aspx) I renamed it to CreateNewWindow but feel free to change the name if you prefer something different.

Testing run on Windows: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_render\_win/199/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_render_win/199/console)
values.title: Several MSVC fixes: enable IgnFindOGRE, ambious use of templates and CreateWindow naming conflict

summary.raw:
Last round of Windows fixes \(although we still we have a linking issue to resolve\):

* Enable the use of IgnFindOGRE
* MSVC complained about the ambiguos use of type Node in templates \(coming from multiple heritance\)
* Change API: [CreateWindow seems to be part of a Windows API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms632679(v=vs.85).aspx) I renamed it to CreateNewWindow but feel free to change the name if you prefer something different.

Testing run on Windows: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_render\_win/199/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_render_win/199/console)
summary.html:
Last round of Windows fixes (although we still we have a linking issue to resolve):

  • Enable the use of IgnFindOGRE
  • MSVC complained about the ambiguos use of type Node in templates (coming from multiple heritance)
  • Change API: CreateWindow seems to be part of a Windows API I renamed it to CreateNewWindow but feel free to change the name if you prefer something different.

Testing run on Windows: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_render_win/199/console

values.description:
Added the base `Ogre2Object` class which all ogre2 objects will derive from \(e.g. visuals, cameras which will come later\). The first derived class being added is the `Ogre2Node` class.

I also added the basic skeleton of the Scene class.  

  
As before, this branch should just build and do nothing more
values.title: Ogre2: Object, Node, Basic Scene skeleton

I also added the basic skeleton of the Scene class.  

  
As before, this branch should just build and do nothing more

Added the base Ogre2Object class which all ogre2 objects will derive from (e.g. visuals, cameras which will come later). The first derived class being added is the Ogre2Node class.

values.description:
Examining the `ign-rendering0.dll` using `dumpbin` shows that symbols were not exported for a few classes.  I'm not sure why but including the the headers of these classes in a source file  in the `src` directory seems to fix it.

Build is now yellow. It compiles but tests are failing:

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_render\_win/205/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_render_win/205/)
values.title: Fix Windows linking errors

Build is now yellow. It compiles but tests are failing:

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_render\_win/205/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_render_win/205/)

values.description:
The undefined symbols on homebrew were caused by the recent addition of inline namespaces.

Fix was just to also wrap the function implementations with the inline namespace.

‌

[homebrew build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_rendering-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/52/) is blue again
values.title: Fix undefined symbols on homebrew

values.description:
Add classes needed to create ogre2 meshes and visuals

Currently the mesh factory object creates ogre v1 meshes \(code ported from ign-rendering’s ogre 1.x component\) then import them to v2 format. Ideally we update the code later to create v2 meshes directly.
values.title: Ogre2: Meshes and Visuals

summary.raw:
Add classes needed to create ogre2 meshes and visuals

Currently the mesh factory object creates ogre v1 meshes \(code ported from ign-rendering’s ogre 1.x component\) then import them to v2 format. Ideally we update the code later to create v2 meshes directly.
summary.html:
Add classes needed to create ogre2 meshes and visuals

Currently the mesh factory object creates ogre v1 meshes (code ported from ign-rendering’s ogre 1.x component) then import them to v2 format. Ideally we update the code later to create v2 meshes directly.

values.description:
For [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/150](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/150) I am interested in attaching a visual to a camera. This change is required to allow that \(FWIU Visuals are the only type of Node that can have other visuals attached like this\).

Are there any issues with this approach, from a design perspective?
values.title: Make sensors Visuals so they can have Visuals attached

Are there any issues with this approach, from a design perspective?

values.description:
Port Lights from ogre 1.9 to Ogre 2.1.

This PR should only compile for now. Let me know if I should add additional tests.

Ambient light interface has changed from 1.9 to 2.1. For now it is configured as traditional fixed-colour ambient light. But now it support to configure upper and lower hemispheres. We might want to review that later.

There are no changes it seems in the [supported light types](https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/2.1/class_ogre_1_1_light.html#a4f1dea084d1497c6f49e802ade940dbc), so directional, point and spot lights should work as before.
values.title: Add Lights to ogre2

summary.raw:
Port Lights from ogre 1.9 to Ogre 2.1.

This PR should only compile for now. Let me know if I should add additional tests.

Ambient light interface has changed from 1.9 to 2.1. For now it is configured as traditional fixed-colour ambient light. But now it support to configure upper and lower hemispheres. We might want to review that later.

There are no changes it seems in the [supported light types](https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/2.1/class_ogre_1_1_light.html#a4f1dea084d1497c6f49e802ade940dbc), so directional, point and spot lights should work as before.
summary.html:
Port Lights from ogre 1.9 to Ogre 2.1.

This PR should only compile for now. Let me know if I should add additional tests.

Ambient light interface has changed from 1.9 to 2.1. For now it is configured as traditional fixed-colour ambient light. But now it support to configure upper and lower hemispheres. We might want to review that later.

There are no changes it seems in the supported light types, so directional, point and spot lights should work as before.

values.description:
Supersedes [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/86](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/86)

Main changes:

* Moved the functions related to adding/removing/accessing children nodes from Visual classes to Node classes.
* Overrode `PreRender` for BaseNode so that it can call it on its children.
* Added a call to `PreRenderChildren` from Camera's `PreRender` so that children visuals will be updated.

There might be room for optimisation in this change: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/6c1cb272286b1825e003038c3d6186b54bf5c457](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/6c1cb272286b1825e003038c3d6186b54bf5c457) but the cast was failing as in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/71/revert-a-change-in-visual-to-fix-text/diff](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/71/revert-a-change-in-visual-to-fix-text/diff)

Have only update Ogre so far but am happy for feedback on what’s there
values.title: Allow nodes to have children attached

summary.raw:
Supersedes [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/86](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/86)

Main changes:

* Moved the functions related to adding/removing/accessing children nodes from Visual classes to Node classes.
* Overrode `PreRender` for BaseNode so that it can call it on its children.
* Added a call to `PreRenderChildren` from Camera's `PreRender` so that children visuals will be updated.

There might be room for optimisation in this change: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/6c1cb272286b1825e003038c3d6186b54bf5c457](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/6c1cb272286b1825e003038c3d6186b54bf5c457) but the cast was failing as in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/71/revert-a-change-in-visual-to-fix-text/diff](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/71/revert-a-change-in-visual-to-fix-text/diff)

Have only update Ogre so far but am happy for feedback on what’s there
summary.html:
Supersedes #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/86

Main changes:

  • Moved the functions related to adding/removing/accessing children nodes from Visual classes to Node classes.
  • Overrode PreRender for BaseNode so that it can call it on its children.
  • Added a call to PreRenderChildren from Camera's PreRender so that children visuals will be updated.

There might be room for optimisation in this change: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/6c1cb272286b1825e003038c3d6186b54bf5c457 but the cast was failing as in #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/71/revert-a-change-in-visual-to-fix-text/diff

Have only update Ogre so far but am happy for feedback on what’s there

values.description:
Added support for ogre2 HLMS PBS materials

Also added an `ogre2_demo` in the examples directory for testing. It’s hardcoded to use the ogre2 render engine.

Below is a screenshot of the demo. ~~The scene is a bit dark and I need to figure out why.~~ But’s the idea is to show that meshes and materials are now working.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/3310281888-ogre_demo3.png)
‌

Update: fixed problem with dark lighting in [a041797](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/a041797793b582d8743d772c58e5694a674bdf39)
values.title: Ogre2: Add Material and ogre2_demo

values.description:
Added an optional argument to `rendering::engine` for passing custom params to the underlying render engine. 

This is currently used to pass a `useCurrentGLContext` param to `ogre` and `ogre2` render engine to instruct them to use the current opengl context and prevent them from creating their own.  This is needed for integration with QtQuick.
values.title: Support passing custom param to render engine

summary.raw:
Added an optional argument to `rendering::engine` for passing custom params to the underlying render engine. 

This is currently used to pass a `useCurrentGLContext` param to `ogre` and `ogre2` render engine to instruct them to use the current opengl context and prevent them from creating their own.  This is needed for integration with QtQuick.
summary.html:
Added an optional argument to rendering::engine for passing custom params to the underlying render engine.

This is currently used to pass a useCurrentGLContext param to ogre and ogre2 render engine to instruct them to use the current opengl context and prevent them from creating their own. This is needed for integration with QtQuick.

values.description:
Some fixes to be compatible with MSVC compilation. 

* Do not use visibility in templated classes
* Use IGN\_PI
* Include Windows header for std::min
* Exclued ogre header not present in Windows. Seems not to be used
* Use directy the header name in Windows
* Workaround to avoid MSVC syntax error
* Include RenderSystem\_GL as linked library for Ogre

Although I've included the `RenderSystem_GL`in Ogre components the MSVC build is still failing with a[ linking error:](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/29/console)

`  OgreRenderTarget.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol "__declspec(dllimport) public: class Ogre::GLFBOManager * __cdecl Ogre::GLFrameBufferObject::getManager(void)" (__imp_?getManager@GLFrameBufferObject@Ogre@@QEAAPEAVGLFBOManager@2@XZ) [D:\Jenkins\workspace\ign_rendering-pr-win\ws\build\ignition-rendering1\ogre\src\ignition-rendering1-ogre.vcxproj]`

@iche033 any idea why could be wrong?
values.title: Gz11 win fixes

summary.raw:
Some fixes to be compatible with MSVC compilation. 

* Do not use visibility in templated classes
* Use IGN\_PI
* Include Windows header for std::min
* Exclued ogre header not present in Windows. Seems not to be used
* Use directy the header name in Windows
* Workaround to avoid MSVC syntax error
* Include RenderSystem\_GL as linked library for Ogre

Although I've included the `RenderSystem_GL`in Ogre components the MSVC build is still failing with a[ linking error:](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/29/console)

`  OgreRenderTarget.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol "__declspec(dllimport) public: class Ogre::GLFBOManager * __cdecl Ogre::GLFrameBufferObject::getManager(void)" (__imp_?getManager@GLFrameBufferObject@Ogre@@QEAAPEAVGLFBOManager@2@XZ) [D:\Jenkins\workspace\ign_rendering-pr-win\ws\build\ignition-rendering1\ogre\src\ignition-rendering1-ogre.vcxproj]`

@iche033 any idea why could be wrong?
summary.html:
Some fixes to be compatible with MSVC compilation.

  • Do not use visibility in templated classes
  • Use IGN_PI
  • Include Windows header for std::min
  • Exclued ogre header not present in Windows. Seems not to be used
  • Use directy the header name in Windows
  • Workaround to avoid MSVC syntax error
  • Include RenderSystem_GL as linked library for Ogre

Although I've included the RenderSystem_GLin Ogre components the MSVC build is still failing with a linking error:

OgreRenderTarget.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol "__declspec(dllimport) public: class Ogre::GLFBOManager * __cdecl Ogre::GLFrameBufferObject::getManager(void)" (__imp_?getManager@GLFrameBufferObject@Ogre@@QEAAPEAVGLFBOManager@2@XZ) [D:\Jenkins\workspace\ign_rendering-pr-win\ws\build\ignition-rendering1\ogre\src\ignition-rendering1-ogre.vcxproj]

@iche033 any idea why could be wrong?
